title: About Free Bing-Yue
text:
Now, there probably aren’t many people who remember this high school episode, but you, who have found your way here, must be seeking some echoes of the past. If you still yearn for that 2013 when everything wasn’t terribly bleak, feel free to return and take on the challenge once more.
现在应该没有多少人还记得这个高中时代的小插曲了，但能找到这里来的你，我想应该是在寻找一些往日的影子。如果你仍然怀念那个一切都还没有非常糟糕的2013，欢迎随时回来再挑战一下。
Free Bing-Yue / 拯救炳跃 (a 2048 clone)
May life treat every character in this story kindly.
愿生活善待这个故事中的每一个人。

In response to a question that curious souls occasionally stumble upon while skimming my social media:
另外回应一个大家偶尔翻看我的社媒后也许会有点好奇的问题:






是什么呢？





我大概还是没有跑去变性的。谢谢关心。

title: Riko Shen’s Personal Page (on GitHub)
text:
Greeting from a Lalafellin





This is a simple homepage used to create using plain HTML without any fancy formatting. Many legendary technicians have designed their pages in this straightforward manner, and I used to choose to follow their “best practices”.
Recently, I discovered that Quarto is quite handy for creating a decent webpage (also a well formatted document). I also realized I might never become a legendary technician, so I decided to rewrite the page in a more modern style — complete with CSS!

title: Riko Shen’s Personal Page (on GitHub)
text:
About Me
I am currently a student pursuing a degree in what is colloquially known as Permanent head Damage in a world’s leading bottom-tier university in Macau SAR. I consider myself a non-qualified script-kiddie and an amateur social science researcher specializing in computational approaches (at least, I think so).
An IRL picture of myself is attached to show that my life is (somehow) on the right track. At the very least, unlike my buddies, I do my makeup and wear proper clothes instead of grid sleeves and pajamas,






and here it is:








The Lalafellin in real life.





I will get back later to provide detailed information about my work. For now, this has worked well.
Riko SHEN
Last update: Oct 2024
Live long and prosper.

title: TO-DO
text:
My advisor set up a To-Do list on the iOS Reminders for all our remaining project tasks. Every time he adds a new item, my phone pings me instantly.
I then jokingly told him that I should attach an IoT-enabled… device (or toy) on my thigh. Whenever the list updates, it gives me little electro-shock.
He went silent for a moment, then asked me where I had learnt about that.
Final Fantasy XIV. I replied.

title: TO-DO
text:
Footnotes


Yes, she wrote SELECT bla-bla-bla FROM bla-bla-bla for a whole night even with a joy on her face.↩︎

title: Riko’s Archive
text:
Family hours. Shot on Dec 22, 2024


No joking, writing killer apology letters was the most valuable skill I picked up during my PhD, courtesy of our amazing faculty.
I got so good at it that I’m thinking of sharing my entire collection from just the first semester (talk about a learning curve). Think of it as my contribution to future PhD students. So if you ever find yourself in a similar bind, feel free to borrow from my templates or get Claude to whip one up for you.
Whenever you’re stressing about writing that next apology email, just remember: there’s a whole community of us out there who’ve been in your shoes. You’re definitely not alone in this!
Wish you luck!

Sorry for Being a Solo Hero

Totally get now that group work was meant to teach collaboration skills (that makes the instructor feels it like a boss), not just finish the project.

The Remote Access Oops

Saving the admin password on the root directory was a bad idea for any trained IT guys. But super poor judgment on my part as well. Will use RDP next time, also unplug the power cord for monitor.
I love the username for the account I created, that’s the best part of my story and it just killed!

title: Riko’s Archive
text:
Lab Works for EDUC8009



Playtime. Shot on Dec 4, 2024



Docs
Repository

An archive for EDUC8009’s weekly lab work in a jupyter flavor. Questions and solutions included.
Although I learned most of the material covered in the lecture decades ago while preparing for the SAT statistics, and I’m not really an SPSS person, the lab work in EDUC8009 has been the most efficient way for me to relieve weekly stress. It may sound strange, but I genuinely enjoy working with datasets that require no further preprocessing.
I appreciate both the assignments and the instructor. Along with the delightful outfits I wear after Wednesday every week, they have made my tough weeks more manageable.

title: Riko at Work!
text: This is a simple repository hosted on Riko’s GitHub for supplementary materials related to his coursework and other projects. The site’s name is inspired by the phenomenon in the comic and anime “Cells at Work!”

title: Riko at Work!
text:

Tables and plots






Lyhe-Mheg Forever. #XMWDXM #FFXIV
